Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text:
A small and cozy bakery in the famous nine streets area.

Bread is ok, the smoked ribeye is a bit too salty. …

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: During my short stay here this time I was only able to sample two broodje places, but I think this one is my favorite. Busy, locals coming in and out constantly. GREAT broodje, I loved the savory mix of mustard and mayo that really kicked my pastrami and cheese up a notch.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Nice small family run deli. Big assortment of sandwiches like the pastrami, old cheese, mustard and pickles.. also you can try Dutch specialties like filet americain.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: In existence for over half a century,  t Kuyltje stands testimony to the speciality sandwiches so loved by the Dutch. With only 4 and a half by 5 metres of floor space,  this must be one of Amsterdam's smallest sandwich shops, but it ranks …

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: We popped by here for a quick sandwich and were so surprised by the quality of the meats and the friendliest shop keeper. I highly recommend this place for a quick bite, especially the pastrami :)

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Very Good handmade sandwiches with dutch products. The lady is really Nice!

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: This is a great choice for a quick lunch in Amsterdam. They have a large variety of sandwich options. We got a ham option and it was very good. The place is really small with not a lot of seating in the restaurant. We took our sandwiches to go and ate them in a park. I would recommend this place for a quick meal.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: One the best shops in Amsterdam!it's not fast food!!!lovely sandwiches with amazing flavour and very tasty!

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Great sandwich shop. Easy to miss or decide not to bother waiting in line to get into this small litte shop, but worth the wait. The small sandwiches make for a perfect quick bite while canvasing through the shopping district. Can be a bit confusing figuring out who’s in line to put their order in vs. who’s waiting on their sandwich.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Yummy sandwiches - tried the classic warm pastrami with cheese and kids had bacon and brie. The bread was a bit too crunchy and a little skimpy on meat but tasty. Seems to be a local favourite!

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Great family owned and operated sandwich shop. The owner is a butcher and you can tell by the quality of the cuts. Their pastrami is excellent. In wintertime try their pea soup. Best in the 9 streets area!

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: There is no better shop if you want to eat a hot or cold snack quickly. These sandwiches are very tasty.  I don't know anything like that. Forget the big chains, it would only need this shop, nothing more.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Amazing little sandwich shop in Amsterdam.  Because I could not read the menu (it was in Dutch) the guy behind the counter recommended the  pastrami and cheese sandwich.  It was freakin delicious.  I only wish it was bigger.  I could eat it everyday.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Quick service, reasonable prices, great food. What more could you want? I highly recommend the smoked chicken and pastrami. Note: the mustard has a strong kick!

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Not a great veggie selection. Coffee was good, but the sandwich was dry despite asking for butter. Fridge was also loud. The owner is nice and interior alright.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Best pastrami sandwich of Amsterdam.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Awesome little sandwich spot. Very friendly owners. We tried the Argentina Roastbeef with butter and the Pastrami. Very cheap eat as well.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: A nice place to get the Dutch Fresh Fish sandwich. It is a bread with fresh fish fillet and pickled onion to minimise the raw flavor of the fish.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Sandwich shop run by a butcher and his wife

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Best sandwiches in town. Pastrami with old cheese. Its really good.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Old school method of preparing a delectable sandwich.  Hand carved, heated, melted, TASTY bread, too.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: John is the owner of this great place. Best sandwiches in the 9 straatjes

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Delicoius freshly made rolls, los of home made stuff, friendly owner and staff.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: This is where locals in the know go for their sandwich. Try their warm Pastrami 'met alles'.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Best pastrami sandwichs in the city. A must.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Two words - Pastrami sandwich!!

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: I could taste the love used to make my sandwich

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: One of my favourite spots for a sandwich Pastrami..

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Good price. Very tasty. Very friendly people.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Great chickpeas soup, sandwiches are great too.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: It is closed until 15th August. Just for those who walked here following Maps suggestions

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Used to love this place, really loved the Zeeuwse Spek.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Among the best sandwiches in Amsterdam

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Great local sandwich shop.

Name: 't Kuyltje
Review Text: Terrific sandwiches!

Review Text: (Translated by Google) We returned to this restaurant a bit by chance but we do not regret! The map is hard to decipher if you do not speak Dutch but the owners are there and helps you choose. They advise you and they are not mistaken! …

Review Text: (Translated by Google) Still the best sandwich shop in Amsterdam. In a city where authentic things disappear like snow in the sun, they effortlessly survive. This says everything about the quality. Try the unbeatable ham cheese salad and …

Review Text: (Translated by Google) I have to admit I never went in. Always have to drop by when I go to the gym. It looks like an old-fashioned butcher from the past, I like that. …

Review Text: (Translated by Google) Fortunately, an old-fashioned Amsterdam sandwich shop with a large selection and which you still pay normal prices. No blah-blah but straightforward quality. That they may still exist for 100 years! …
